page.title: 17TRANSPORT
page.content: A{mini-bus service}has just started based in Maryculter. It is called {Dial-a-Ride.}You telephone if you are wanting picked up and takes you into the city where you can use the city bus service if necessary. { Nearly every household in the area {has a car.}If people have good cars they must have good jobs. There are good jobs here because of the prosperity from The Oil Industry in nearby Aberedeen. We have a coal merchant who lives in Banchory-Devenick and he needs{lorries that can take heavy weights. We have a{car dealer in}the community but no garage. There are of course many{farm vehicles}in this rural area. We daily see{aeroplanes and {helicopters}flying overhead on their way to busy Dyce Airport in the north of Aberdeen.
